title: Again, just skirting the problem...
body:
_"It's still possible that Thunderlord's is over-tuned after all this"_

you're goddamn right!

replies.body: its not overtuned, it was because the other keystones were too strong or underwhelming which was quoted by gypsy
Mark my words this wont change, by the start of the next patch there will still be 8+ thunderlords in every game.
The question i want to pose to you though is, is that because the other keystones are bad, or because people don't understand the damage output of the masteries/utility of the masteries.

3 reasons

1. Because all that most people care about is dealing as much damage as quickly as possible, and are blind to other more tactical possibilities however strong they are.

2. because if you're a normal AP mage your only viable options are deathfire and thunderlords, (now refer to reason 1)

3. Supports dont 'support' anymore, its just become 'AP mid' but in bot lane, (now refer to reason 1)

Unfortunately, your number 1 is 100% true. And this really bugs me, I don't actually think Thunderlord's is OP, I agree with Rito on that, but a lot of people, don't even read patch notes, so they'll have no idea that the other masteries got buffed and most of them just don't care since they just want the damage. What they don't know is, taking Thunderlord's on **full** tank Malphite is no where near as good as taking Grasp of the Undying since you're not building any Attack Damage or Ability Power, whereas you ARE building health,  which is what Grasp of the Undying scales off of, so while Thunderlord's base damage is still very good, you aren't maximising your builds by taking it if you aren't going to help it scale. Same goes for Cinderhulk Junglers! Strength of the Ages directly compliments Cinderhulk and Thunderlord's doesn't compliment you unless you're planning on building damage later on.
Give it some time, the patch just hit and it will take a while for everyone to feel out the changes to the masteries.
I'm so sick of seeing thunderlords on almost every player they just need to nerf it for gods sake :(

People were picking Thunderlords because Precision was broken. It was giving 14 armor pen + 8.4 magic pen at level 18. With the armor pen nerfed and Fervor of Battle buffed (+30 AD at max level/stacks compared to previous patch), Thunderlords won't be picked 8/10 times in a match.

95% of the reason why I almost always choose Thunderlord's is because I really want the extra 5% CDR Mastery, which you can't get if you grab any other keystone except the other two in Cunning...
The Movespeed Buff on dealing a certain amount of damage I'm not a huge fan of unless I'm on Hecarim and the increased heals and shielding is obviously only going to be certain choice picks again, E.G Raka/Nami/Janna etc
They could buff every other keystone as much as they like as long as the 5% CDR is where it is I'll be grabbing Thunderlord's almost everytime xD

Also a lot of the other Keystone's while useful, are mostly suited to specific champions.. while Thunderlord's is great on just about every champion, thus why you see it a lot.
